monster.name: Agdon Longscarf
monster.speed: walk 35 ft., or 70 ft. while wearing his scarf
monster.skill: Acrobatics +7, Perception +6, Sleight Of Hand +7, Stealth +7

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If Agdon is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if he fails, provided he isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: Agdon's long jump is up to 20 feet and his high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Agdon makes two Branding Iron or Dagger attacks.

action.name: Branding Iron
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage, and the target is magically branded.
Agdon is invisible to creatures branded in this way. The brand disappears after 24 hours, or it can be removed from a creature or object by any spell that ends a curse.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Quick Fingers (Bonus Action)
action.text: Agdon targets one creature within 5 feet of him that he can see and makes a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, with a DC equal to 1 + the target's passive Wisdom (Perception) score. On a successful check, Agdon pilfers one object weighing 1 pound or less that the target has in its possession but not in its grasp, without the target noticing the theft.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: Agdon halves the damage that he takes from an attack that hits him. He must be able to see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 73

monster.name: Alagarthas

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: Alagarthas has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Alagarthas has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Alagarthas makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: For 1 minute, Alagarthas can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand him. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if Alagarthas is incapacitated.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 144

monster.name: Amidor the Dandelion

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
trait.text: Amidor can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if it shared a language with them.

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Seed Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
reaction.text: Amidor adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, Amidor must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 135

monster.name: Bavlorna Blightstraw

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Bavlorna can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Boon of Immortality
trait.text: Bavlorna is immune to any effect that would age her, and she can't die from old age.

trait.name: Widdershins Allergy
trait.text: If a creature within 10 feet of Bavlorna uses at least 10 feet of movement to run in place counterclockwise, Bavlorna is overcome by a fit of sneezing and can't cast spells until the end of her next turn. In addition, any creature Bavlorna has swallowed is immediately expelled and falls prone in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of her.

trait.name: Shared Spells Of The Hourglass Coven
trait.text:
On the rare occasions when all three hags of the Hourglass Coven are within 30 feet of one another, any one of them can use an action to cast one of the following spells, requiring no material components (spell save DC 14):
detect thoughts, dispel magic, finger of death, glibness, locate creature, mass suggestion.
Once a spell from this list has been cast, no member of the coven can cast that shared spell again until the next dawn, when the coven regains all of its shared spells.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Bavlorna makes one Bite attack and one Withering Ray attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) if it is a Medium or smaller creature.
Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Bavlorna can't use her Bite attack on another target.

action.name: Withering Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Create Lornlings (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Bavlorna creates one or two 1-foot-tall duplicates of herself, called lornlings (use the Quickling stat block in appendix C). Each lornling appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of Bavlorna, obeys her commands, and takes its turn immediately after hers. A lornling lasts for 1 hour, until it or Bavlorna dies, or until Bavlorna dismisses it as an action. Bavlorna can have no more than eight lornlings in existence at a time.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Bavlorna casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: detect magic • 2/Day each: create food and water, polymorph, remove curse • 1/Day: plane shift (self only)

action.name: Swallow (Bonus Action)
action.text: Bavlorna swallows a Small or smaller creature she is grappling, ending the grapple on it. The swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Bavlorna, and it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. If the swallowed creature is one of Bavlorna's lornlings, Bavlorna gains all the lornling's memories when the acid damage reduces it to 0 hit points. Bavlorna can have only one creature swallowed at a time. If Bavlorna dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

monster.spells: detect magic, create food and water, polymorph, remove curse, plane shift, detect thoughts, dispel magic, finger of death, glibness, locate creature, mass suggestion
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 216

monster.name: Boggle

action.name: Pummel
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d6-1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Oil Puddle
action.text:
The boggle creates a puddle of oil that is either slippery or sticky (boggle's choice). The puddle is 1 inch deep and covers the ground in the boggle's space. The puddle is difficult terrain For all creatures except boggles and lasts for 1 hour.
If the oil is slippery, any creature that enters the puddle's area or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.
If the oil is sticky, any creature that enters the puddle's area or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be restrained. On its turn. a creature can use an action to try to extricate itself from the sticky puddle, ending the effect and moving into the nearest safe unoccupied space with a successful DC 11 Strength check.

action.name: Boggle Oil (Bonus Action)
action.text: The boggle excretes nonflammable oil from its pores. The boggle chooses whether the oil is slippery or sticky and can change the oil on its skin from one consistency to another as a bonus action.

action.name: Slippery Oil (Bonus Action)
action.text: The boggle has advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to escape bonds and end grapples, and it can move through openings large enough for a Tiny creature without squeezing.

action.name: Sticky Oil (Bonus Action)
action.text: The boggle has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple and any ability check made to maintain a hold on another creature, a surface, or an object. The boggle can also climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Dimensional Rift (Bonus Action)
action.text: As a bonus action, the boggle can create an invisible and immobile rift within an opening or frame it can see within 5 feet of it, provided that the space is no bigger than 10 feet on any side. The dimensional rift bridges the distance between that space and any point within 30 feet of it that the boggle can see or specify by distance and direction (such as "30 feet straight up"). While next to the rift, the boggle can see through it and is considered to be next to the destination as well, and anything the boggle puts through the rift (including a portion of its body) emerges at the destination. Only the boggle can use the rift, and it lasts until the end of the boggle's next turn.

monster.description: Source: Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 128, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 229

monster.name: Brigganock

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The brigganock has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Soul Light
trait.text: The brigganock is accompanied by an insubstantial, invulnerable ball of light that contains its soul. The brigganock can't turn off the light or control its brightness. The soul light sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. If the brigganock dies, its soul light fades away.

trait.name: Tunneler
trait.text: Using a pickaxe or similar tool, a brigganock can burrow through solid rock at a speed of 5 feet, leaving a 6-inch-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Pickaxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text: The brigganock casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 11): • At will: minor illusion, spare the dying • 1/Day each: animal friendship, faerie fire, meld into stone, silence

action.name: Time Lapse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The brigganock accelerates the passage of time around itself, enabling it to accomplish up to 1 hour of work in a matter of seconds. This work can't affect any creature other than the brigganock, or any object being worn or carried by another creature, and the activity must take place within a 10-foot cube. For example, the brigganock could use this action to rapidly carve a pumpkin, cook and eat dinner, move a pile of stones, or tie a dozen knots in a length of rope.

action.name: Move Soul Light (Bonus Action)
action.text: The brigganock moves its soul light up to 30 feet in any direction to an unoccupied space it can see. At the end of the current turn, the light returns to the brigganock.

monster.spells: minor illusion, spare the dying, animal friendship, faerie fire, meld into stone, silence
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 230

monster.name: Bullywug Knight

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The knight can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
trait.text: The knight can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The knight's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The knight makes two Glaive attacks.

action.name: Glaive
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Croak of Charming (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The knight makes a loud croak while targeting one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the end of its next turn.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 231

monster.name: Bullywug Royal

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The royal can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
trait.text: The royal can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
trait.text: The royal has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The royal's long jump is up to 20 ft. and its high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start.

trait.name: Toad Rider
trait.text: The royal has advantage on melee attacks made while riding on a Toad mount

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The royal makes two Spear attacks.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit (with advantage if the royal is mounted on a toad), reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Croaked Decree (Recharge 5-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The royal makes a loud pronouncement. Each ally of the royal that is within 60 feet of the royal and can hear the pronouncement has advantage on its first attack roll on its next turn.

monster.description: Source: Ghosts of Saltmarsh p. 232, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 231

monster.name: Campestri
monster.languages: understands Common but speaks only through the use of its Mimicry trait

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: The campestri can mimic any voice or song it has heard, albeit in a nasal falsetto.

action.name: Head Butt
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spores (1/Day)
action.text: A 5-foot radius of spores extends from the campestri. These spores can go around corners, and they have no effect on Constructs, Elementals, Plants, or Undead. Each other creature in the area must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated and its speed is halved, both for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 232

monster.name: Clapperclaw the Scarecrow
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, unconscious

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: Clapperclaw doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Stuffing
action.text: Clapperclaw stuffs straw or other dead plant matter into itself and regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. Roll a d6; on a 1 or 2, Clapperclaw runs out of stuffing and must spend 8 hours foraging for more before it can use this action again.

action.name: Unsettling Presence (Recharge 6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Clapperclaw targets one creature it can see within 15 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be magically frightened until the end of Clapperclaw's next turn.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 78

monster.name: Darkling Elder

trait.name: Death Burn
trait.text: When the darkling elder dies, magical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 7 (2d6) radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The darkling elder makes two scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Darkness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The darkling elder casts darkness, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

monster.spells: darkness
monster.description: Source: Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 134, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 233

monster.name: Darkling

trait.name: Death Flash
trait.text: When the darkling dies, nonmagical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area and able to see the bright light must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
trait.text: While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

monster.description: Source: Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 134, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 233

monster.name: Displacer Beast Kitten

trait.name: Displacement
trait.text: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

action.name: Tentacles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 bludgeoning damage plus 2 piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 108

monster.name: Elkhorn

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Elkhorn wields a +1 longsword.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Elkhorn makes two Dagger or +1 Longsword attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage. If the target is a creature that is Large or bigger, it takes an extra 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

action.name: +1 Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) slashing damage, or 5 (1d10) slashing damage when used with two hands. If the target is a creature that is Large or bigger, it takes an extra 5 (1d10) slashing damage.

action.name: Feint (Recharge 5-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Elkhorn targets one creature that he can see within 5 feet of him. Elkhorn has advantage on the next attack roll he makes against that target before the end of his turn. If that attack hits, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage of the weapon's type.

action.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Elkhorn regains 12 hit points.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 224

monster.name: Endelyn Moongrave

trait.name: Boon of Immortality
trait.text: Endelyn is immune to any effect that would age her, and she can't die from old age.

trait.name: Eclipsed Doom
trait.text: Endelyn can be killed only if she is reduced to 0 hit points during a solar eclipse or while she is within 60 feet of a symbolic representation of one. Otherwise, Endelyn disappears in a cloud of inky smoke when she drops to 0 hit points, along with anything she was wearing or carrying, and reappears 24 hours later in the same location or the nearest unoccupied space.

trait.name: Uncanny Awareness
trait.text: Endelyn can't be surprised.

trait.name: Shared Spells Of The Hourglass Coven
trait.text:
On the rare occasions when all three hags of the Hourglass Coven are within 30 feet of one another, any one of them can use an action to cast one of the following spells, requiring no material components (spell save DC 14):
detect thoughts, dispel magic, finger of death, glibness, locate creature, mass suggestion.
Once a spell from this list has been cast, no member of the coven can cast that shared spell again until the next dawn, when the coven regains all of its shared spells.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Endelyn makes two Puppeteer's Lash attacks

action.name: Puppeteer's Lash
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, Endelyn telekinetically moves it up to 10 feet in any direction horizontally.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Endelyn casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: detect magic, mage hand • 2/Day each: augury, polymorph • 1/Day: plane shift (self only)

monster.spells: detect magic, mage hand, augury, polymorph, plane shift, detect thoughts, dispel magic, finger of death, glibness, locate creature, mass suggestion
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 217

monster.name: Envy

trait.name: Trampling Charge
trait.text: If Envy moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, Envy can make one attack with its claws against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Petrifying Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Envy exhales petrifying gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 178

monster.name: Flying Rocking Horse
monster.speed: walk 0 ft., fly 40 ft. (only while mounted; hover)
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the rocking horse is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the rocking horse move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the rocking horse is animate.

trait.name: Flying Mount
trait.text: The rocking horse can serve as a mount for a Medium or smaller creature and can fly only while mounted.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The rocking horse doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it regains no hit points or Hit Dice at the end of a long rest.

action.name: Head Butt
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 121

monster.name: Giant Dragonfly

trait.name: Drone
trait.text: When it beats its wings, the dragonfly emits a loud droning sound that can be heard out to a range of 120 feet.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: The dragonfly halves the damage it takes from an attack made against it, provided it can see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 234

monster.name: Giant Snail

trait.name: Salt Osmosis
trait.text: Whenever the snail starts its turn in contact with a pound or more of salt, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage. Using an action to sprinkle a pound of salt on the snail deals 1d4 necrotic damage to it immediately and another 1d4 necrotic damage to it at the start of its next turn (after which the salt rubs off), provided the snail has not withdrawn into its shell.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shell Defense
action.text: The snail withdraws into its shell, gaining a +4 bonus to its AC until it emerges. It can emerge from its shell as a bonus action on its turn.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 234

monster.name: Giant Swan

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The swan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The swan makes two attacks with its beak.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 38

monster.name: Glass Pegasus
monster.languages: Celestial, Common, Elvish and Sylvan but can't speak

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 181

monster.name: Glasswork Golem
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monster.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive perception 10

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the golem is embedded in a window and motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the golem move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the golem is animate.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The golem regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the golem takes bludgeoning or thunder damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the golem's next turn. The golem is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The golem makes two Glass Sword attacks.

action.name: Glass Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

action.name: Dazzling Light (Recharge 5-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Magical, colored light springs from the golem in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 193

monster.name: Gloam

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

action.name: Cloud of Dust
action.text: On its first turn in combat or when it is reduced to 0 hit points, the cat expels a cloud of dust that acts as dust of sneezing and choking

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 93

monster.name: Harengon Brigand

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The harengon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the harengon's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The harengon's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 235

monster.name: Harengon Sniper

trait.name: Standing Leap
trait.text: The harengon's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Club
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit (the target gains no benefit from less than total cover), range 320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. Hit or Miss: Immediately after making this attack, the harengon can use the Hide action.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 235

monster.name: Iggwilv the Witch Queen
monster.languages: Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Draconic, Elvish, Infernal, Sylvan

trait.name: Boon of Immortality
trait.text: Iggwilv is immune to any effect that would age her, and she can't die from old age.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Iggwilv fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Iggwilv has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. (This trait is bestowed by her robe of the archmagi.)

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Iggwilv wears an amulet of the planes and a robe of the archmagi.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Iggwilv makes two Bewitching Bolt attacks.

action.name: Bewitching Bolt
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +16 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (5d6 + 8) lightning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by Iggwilv until the start of her next turn.

action.name: Abyssal Rift (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Iggwilv opens a momentary Abyssal rift within 120 feet of her. The rift is a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 40 (9d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, there is a 50 percent chance that 3 hezrous then appear in unoccupied spaces in the sphere. They act as Iggwilv's allies, take their turns immediately after hers, and can't summon other demons. They remain until they die or until Iggwilv dismisses them as an action.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Iggwilv casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24, +16 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: detect magic, disguise self, invisibility, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation, Tasha's hideous laughter • 3/Day each: dispel magic, fly, polymorph • 1/Day each: maze, telekinesis, teleport, wish

action.name: Fey Step (Bonus Action)
action.text: Iggwilv teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space she can see within 30 feet of her.

reaction.name: Negate Spell (2/Day)
reaction.text: When Iggwilv sees a creature within 60 feet of her casting a spell, she tries to interrupt it. If the creature is casting a spell using a spell slot of 8th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a 9th-level spell, it must succeed on a DC 22 Intelligence saving throw, or the spells fails and has no effect.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Iggwilv can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Iggwilv regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Witchcraft
legendary.text: Iggwilv uses Spellcasting or Fey Step.

legendary.name: Dark Speech (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Iggwilv utters a phrase in a forbidden language and targets one or two creatures she can see within 60 feet of her. Each target must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage and be frightened of Iggwilv for 1 minute. A target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success and thereby becoming immune to Iggwilv's Dark Speech for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Fey Beguilement (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Iggwilv targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Charisma saving throw or be possessed by a fey spirit. While possessed, the target must obey Iggwilv's commands. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, banishing the fey spirit and ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: detect magic, disguise self, invisibility, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation, Tasha's hideous laughter, dispel magic, fly, polymorph, maze, telekinesis, teleport, wish
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 205

monster.name: Jabberwock
monster.speed: walk 30 ft., climb 30 ft., fly 30 ft., swim 30 ft.
monster.save: Str +10, Dex +6, Con +10, Int +2, Wis +3, Cha +5

trait.name: Confusing Burble
trait.text:
The jabberwock burbles to itself unless it is incapacitated. Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the jabberwock and is able to hear its burbling must make a DC 18 Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and it rolls a d4 to determine what it does during its current turn:
1-2. The creature does nothing. 3. The creature does nothing except use all its movement to move in a random direction. 4. The creature either makes one melee attack against a random creature it can see or does nothing if no visible creature is within its reach.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the jabberwock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The jabberwock regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the jabberwock takes slashing damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The jabberwock dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Uncanny Tracker
trait.text: The jabberwock can unerringly track any creature it has wounded in the last 24 hours, and it knows the distance and direction to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The jabberwock makes two Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fiery Gaze (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Unless it is blinded, the jabberwock emits a 120-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line of fire from its eyes. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: The jabberwock can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The jabberwock regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
legendary.text: The jabberwock makes one Tail attack.

legendary.name: Rend Attack (2 Actions)
legendary.text: The jabberwock makes one Rend attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (3 Actions)
legendary.text: The jabberwock beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the jabberwock must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 236

monster.name: Jingle Jangle

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: Jingle Jangle can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

action.name: Flail of Locks
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (3d4) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 70

monster.name: Kelek

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Kelek wears bracers of defense and carries a staff of striking with 10 charges. The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If its last charge is expended, roll a d20; on a 1, the staff becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Kelek makes three attacks using Sorcerer's Bolt, Staff of Striking, or a combination of them. He can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Sorcerer's Bolt
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d12) force damage.

action.name: Staff of Striking
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, or 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands, and Kelek can expend up to 3 of the staff's charges, dealing an extra 3 (1d6) force damage for each expended charge.

action.name: Fiery Explosion (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: Kelek creates a magical explosion of fire centered on a point he can see within 120 feet of him. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Kelek casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: light, mage hand, prestidigitation • 1/Day each: dominate beast, fly, mirror image, web

reaction.name: Arcane Defense (3/Day)
reaction.text: When he is hit by an attack, Kelek protects himself with an invisible barrier of magical force. Until the end of his next turn, he gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack.

monster.spells: light, mage hand, prestidigitation, dominate beast, fly, mirror image, web
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 219

monster.name: Kettlesteam the Kenku
monster.skill: Arcana +2, Deception +5, Investigation +2, Perception +2, Persuasion +5, Stealth +5
monster.languages: understands Auran and Common but speaks only through the use of her Mimicry trait

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: Kettlesteam can mimic any sounds she has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful DC 13 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Kettlesteam makes two Dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Kettlesteam casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: disguise self, friends, mage hand, minor illusion • 1/Day each: bestow curse, faerie fire, speak with animals

action.name: Twilight Sleep (2/Day)
action.text: Kettlesteam targets one creature she can see within 10 feet of her. The target is engulfed in a cloud of magical, sleep-inducing gas and must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 1 minute. A creature put to sleep by this gas awakens instantly if it takes damage, or if someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

monster.spells: disguise self, friends, mage hand, minor illusion, bestow curse, faerie fire, speak with animals
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 52

monster.name: Korred
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
trait.text: The korred has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The korred makes two Greatclub or Rock attacks.

action.name: Greatclub
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The korred casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: commune with nature (as an action), meld into stone, stone shape • 1/Day each: Otto's irresistible dance

action.name: Command Hair (Bonus Action)
action.text: The korred has at least one 50-foot-long rope woven out of its hair. The korred commands one such rope within 30 feet of it to move up to 20 feet and entangle a Large or smaller creature that the korred can see. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or become grappled by the rope (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The korred can use a bonus action to release the target, which is also freed if the korred dies or becomes incapacitated. A rope of korred hair has AC 20 and 20 hit points. It regains 1 hit point at the start of each of the korred's turns while the rope has at least 1 hit point and the korred is alive. If the rope drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

monster.spells: commune with nature, meld into stone, stone shape, Otto's irresistible dance
monster.description: Source: Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 168, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 237

monster.name: Living Doll

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the doll is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the doll move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the doll is animate.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The doll regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the doll takes fire or psychic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the doll's next turn. The doll is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The doll doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Grabby Hands
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 6) and takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until this grapple ends. The doll can grapple only one creature at a time.

action.name: Cackle (Recharge 4-6) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The doll cackles as it targets one or two creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target that can hear the doll's cackling must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw, succeeding automatically if it has an Intelligence of 4 or lower. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes 5 (2d4) psychic damage and is incapacitated for 1 minute as it is overcome by a fit of laughter. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this doll's Cackle for 24 hours.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 238

monster.name: Mercion

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Mercion wields a +1 quarterstaff.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Mercion makes one Divine Radiance attack and one +1 Quarterstaff attack. She can replace one of these attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Divine Radiance
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) radiant damage.

action.name: +1 Quarterstaff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Radiant Fire (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Mercion creates a magical explosion of fiery radiance centered on a point she can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Mercion casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: light, spare the dying • 2/Day each: command, create food and water, cure wounds, faerie fire, hold person, revivify • 1/Day: death ward

monster.spells: light, spare the dying, command, create food and water, cure wounds, faerie fire, hold person, revivify, death ward
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 224

monster.name: Mister Light

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Light has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Light carries and is attuned to the Witchlight vane. In Light's hands, the vane is a finesse weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Light makes two Witchlight vane attacks.

action.name: Witchlight Vane
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
While carrying the Witchlight vane, Light casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: dancing lights, polymorph (after casting, roll a d8; on a roll of 3 or 8, Witch can't cast the spell again until the next dawn), ray of frost

action.name: Blessing of the Raven Queen (1/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Witch magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Until the start of his next turn, he appears ghostly and gains resistance to all damage.

monster.spells: dancing lights, polymorph, ray of frost
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 26

monster.name: Mister Witch

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Witch has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put him to sleep.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Witch carries and is attuned to the Witchlight watch.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Witch makes two Cane attacks.

action.name: Cane
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 6 (1d12) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
While carrying the Witchlight watch, Witch casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks):
• At will: fire bolt, invisibility (after casting, roll a d8; on a roll of 3 or 8, Witch can't cast the spell again until the next dawn), message

action.name: Blessing of the Raven Queen (1/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Witch magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Until the start of his next turn, he appears ghostly and gains resistance to all damage.

monster.spells: fire bolt, invisibility, message
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 25

monster.name: Molliver

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: When subjected to an effect that allows a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Molliver takes no damage on a successful save or half damage on a failed one, provided Molliver is not incapacitated.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Molliver wears +1 leather armor and boots of levitation.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Molliver makes two Dagger or Shortsword attacks, or one of each.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. The attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage if Molliver has advantage on the attack roll or if the target is within 5 feet of one of Molliver's allies.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. The attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage if Molliver has advantage on the attack roll or if the target is within 5 feet of one of Molliver's allies.

action.name: Levitate
action.text: While wearing boots of levitation, Molliver casts levitate (self only).

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: Molliver halves the damage they take from an attack made against them, provided they can see the attacker.

monster.spells: levitate
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 226

monster.name: Paper Bird

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The paper bird has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Sharp Edges
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 166

monster.name: Pollenella the Honeybee

action.name: Sting
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 135

monster.name: Quickling
monster.skill: Acrobatics +8, Perception +5, Sleight Of Hand +8, Stealth +8

trait.name: Blurred Movement
trait.text: Attack rolls against the quickling have disadvantage unless the quickling is incapacitated or restrained.

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the quickling is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The quickling makes three dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4+6) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 187, Lost Laboratory of Kwalish p. 46, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 239

monster.name: Raezil
monster.skill: Deception +5, Insight +4, Investigation +5, Perception +6, Persuasion +5, Sleight Of Hand +4, Stealth +4

trait.name: Cunning Action
trait.text: On each of her turns, Raezil can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: Raezil has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: Raezil deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when she hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of hers that isn't incapacitated and Raezil doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Raezil makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 193

monster.name: Redcap

trait.name: Iron Boots
trait.text: While moving, the redcap has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

trait.name: Outsize Strength
trait.text: While grappling, the redcap is considered to be Medium. Also, wielding a heavy weapon doesn't impose disadvantage on its attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The redcap makes three attacks with its wicked sickle.

action.name: Wicked Sickle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d4+4) slashing damage.

action.name: Ironbound Pursuit
action.text: The redcap moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and kicks with its iron boots. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or take 20 (3d10+4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

monster.description:
A redcap is a homicidal fey creature born of blood lust. Although small, redcaps have formidable strength.
In the Feywild, or in places where that plane touches another plane at a fey crossing, one or more redcaps might appear where fresh blood soaks the ground. At first, new redcaps look like tiny, bloodstained mushrooms just pushing their caps out of the soil. When moonlight shines on one of these caps, a creature that looks like a wizened and undersized gnome with a hunched back and a sinewy frame springs from the earth. The creature has a pointed leather cap, pants of similar material, heavy iron boots, and a heavy bladed weapon. From the moment it awakens, a redcap desires only murder and carnage, and it sets out to satisfy these cravings. Even if a redcap wanted to be stealthy, its iron boots force it to take ponderous, thunderous steps.
To sustain its unnatural existence, a redcap must soak its hat in the fresh blood of its victims. If the blood isn't replenished at least once every three days, the redcap vanishes as if it had never been. A redcap's desire to slay is rooted in its will to survive.
Source: Volo's Guide to Monsters p. 188, Baldur's Gate: Descent Into Avernus p. 240, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 240

monster.name: Ringlerun
monster.save: Str +2, Dex +3, Con +2, Int +6, Wis +4, Cha +3

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Ringlerun wields a staff of power. It has 20 charges when fully charged and regains 2d8 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If its last charge is expended, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff retains its +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls but loses its other properties; on a 20, it regains 1d8 + 2 charges.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Ringlerun makes three Staff of Power or Freezing Ray attacks. He can replace one of those attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Staff of Power
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands, and Ringlerun can expend 1 of the staff's charges to deal an extra 3 (1d6) force damage.

action.name: Freezing Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 27 (6d8) cold damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Ringlerun casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: light, mage hand, prestidigitation • 3/Day each: charm person, detect magic, sleep • 1/Day each: banishment, dispel magic, fly, knock

action.name: Staff Spell
action.text: While holding his staff of power, Ringlerun can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it (spell save DC 14, +8 to hit with spell attacks): cone of cold (8d8 cold damage; 5 charges), fireball (10d6 fire damage; 5 charges), globe of invulnerability (6 charges), hold monster (5 charges), levitate (2 charges), lightning bolt (10d6 lightning damage; 5 charges), magic missile (1 charge), ray of enfeeblement (1 charge), or wall of force (5 charges).

monster.spells: light, mage hand, prestidigitation, charm person, detect magic, sleep, banishment, dispel magic, fly, knock, cone of cold, fireball, globe of invulnerability, hold monster, levitate, lightning bolt, magic missile, ray of enfeeblement, wall of force
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 227

monster.name: Selenelion Twin

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The Selenelion twins, Gleam and Glister, have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put them to sleep.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: A Selenelion twin regains 5 hit points at the start of her turn as long as both twins are alive and within 60 feet of each other. A twin dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Twin Bond
trait.text: While both Selenelion twins are alive and on the same plane of existence, each is aware of the other's emotions.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Moon Ray (Gleam Only; 3/Day)
action.text:
Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) radiant damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be transformed into a bat for 1 minute, as though affected by a polymorph spell.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Sun Ray (Glister Only; 3/Day)
action.text:
Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) radiant damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be blinded for 1 minute.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Twin Sight (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: In her mind's eye, a Selenelion twin can see what the other twin sees for up to 1 minute, provided both twins are alive and on the same plane of existence. Maintaining this effect requires concentration (as if concentrating on a spell).

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 241

monster.name: Shadow (Variant)
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

trait.name: Amorphous
trait.text: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
trait.text: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
trait.text: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Strength Drain
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4.
The target falls unconscious if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 213

monster.name: Sir Talavar

trait.name: Superior Invisibility
trait.text: As a bonus action, Sir Talavar can magically turn invisible until his concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment Sir Talavar wears or carries is invisible with him.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
trait.text: Using telepathy, Sir Talavar can magically communicate with any other faerie dragon within 60 feet of him.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Sir Talavar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
Sir Talavar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast a number of spells, requiring no material components.
• 1/Day: color spray (Orange), mirror image (Yellow), suggestion (Green), major image (Blue), hallucinatory terrain (Indigo), polymorph (Violet) • 1/Day each: dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion
Violet, 1/Day: polymorph

action.name: +1 Tiny Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

action.name: Euphoria Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Sir Talavar exhales a puff of euphoria gas at one creature within 5 feet of him. The target must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw, or for 1 minute, the target can't take reactions and must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn: 1-4. The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction. 5-6. The target doesn't move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.spells: color spray, mirror image, suggestion, major image, hallucinatory terrain, polymorph, dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 69

monster.name: Skabatha Nightshade

trait.name: Boon of Immortality
trait.text: Skabatha is immune to any effect that would age her, and she can't die from old age.

trait.name: Forgetfulness
trait.text: The first creature that Skabatha sees after she finishes a long rest is invisible to her. She can't remember seeing the creature or perceive it using her truesight until the end of her next long rest.

trait.name: Shared Spells Of The Hourglass Coven
trait.text:
On the rare occasions when all three hags of the Hourglass Coven are within 30 feet of one another, any one of them can use an action to cast one of the following spells, requiring no material components (spell save DC 14):
detect thoughts, dispel magic, finger of death, glibness, locate creature, mass suggestion.
Once a spell from this list has been cast, no member of the coven can cast that shared spell again until the next dawn, when the coven regains all of its shared spells.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Skabatha makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) poison damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Skabatha casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
• At will: detect magic, druidcraft, speak with animals • 2/Day each: polymorph, remove curse, speak with plants • 1/Day: awaken (as an action), plane shift (self only)

action.name: Alter Size (Bonus Action)
action.text:
Skabatha magically shrinks herself to Tiny size (between 4 and 8 inches tall) or returns to her normal size. If Skabatha lacks the room to return to her normal size, she attains the maximum size possible in the space available. Anything she is wearing or carrying changes size along with her.
As a Tiny creature, Skabatha deals 2 (1d4) poison damage when she hits with a Claw attack. She has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. Her statistics otherwise remain unchanged.

monster.spells: detect magic, druidcraft, speak with animals, polymorph, remove curse, speak with plants, awaken, plane shift, detect thoughts, dispel magic, finger of death, glibness, locate creature, mass suggestion
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 218

monster.name: Skylla

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Skylla carries an eldritch staff (see appendix A) with 10 charges. The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If its last charge is expended, roll a d20; on a 1, the staff is destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Skylla makes two Eldritch Staff attacks. She can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Eldritch Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands, and Skylla can expend up to 3 of the staff's charges, dealing an extra 4 (1d8) lightning damage for each expended charge.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Skylla casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• 1/Day each: detect magic, disguise self, faerie fire, fly, hypnotic pattern, invisibility, mage armor

reaction.name: Eldritch Escape
reaction.text: When Skylla takes damage, she can expend 3 charges of her eldritch staff to turn invisible and teleport, along with any equipment she's wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space she can see. She remains invisible until the start of her next turn or until she attacks or casts a spell.

monster.spells: detect magic, disguise self, faerie fire, fly, hypnotic pattern, invisibility, mage armor
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 220

monster.name: Squirt the Oilcan

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If Squirt is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed Squirt move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that Squirt is animate.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: Squirt doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Boggle Oil (3 Applications)
action.text: Squirt expends 1 application of boggle oil to create a 10-foot-square puddle of slippery, non-flammable oil on the ground within 5 feet of it. The puddle is difficult terrain and lasts for 1 hour. Each creature that enters the puddle's area or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 11 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. Boggles are unaffected by the oil. After it expends all 3 applications, Squirt can't use this action again until its supply of boggle oil is replenished.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 110

monster.name: Strongheart

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Strongheart wields Steel, a sentient, lawful good longsword (see appendix A).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Strongheart makes three Steel attacks.

action.name: Steel
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage when used with two hands. Once on each of his turns, Strongheart can also cause the blade to gleam with holy light. If he does so, the target is blinded until the start of Strongheart's next turn.

action.name: Revivify (Recharges at the Next Dawn)
action.text: While holding Steel, Strongheart casts revivify.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Strongheart casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• 3/Day each: command, detect evil and good, protection from evil and good • 1/Day each: lesser restoration, remove curse, zone of truth

reaction.name: Protect Another
reaction.text: When a creature Strongheart can see attacks another creature that is within 5 feet of him, Strongheart can use his reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, provided he is carrying a shield.

monster.spells: revivify, command, detect evil and good, protection from evil and good, lesser restoration, remove curse, zone of truth
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 228

monster.name: Swarm of Campestris
monster.languages: understands Common but speaks only through the use of its Mimicry trait
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

trait.name: Mimicry
trait.text: Each campestri in the swarm can mimic any voice or song it has heard, albeit in a nasal falsetto.

trait.name: Swarm
trait.text: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough to accommodate an individual campestri. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Head Butts
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (4d4) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Spores (1/Day)
action.text: A 20-foot radius of spores extends from the swarm. These spores can go around corners, and they have no effect on Constructs, Elementals, Plants, or Undead. Each other creature in the area must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated and its speed is halved, both for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 232

monster.name: Tin Soldier
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
trait.text: The tin soldier is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the tin soldier must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the tin soldier remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tin soldier makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 115

monster.name: Treant Sapling

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the treant is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the treant move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the treant is animate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The treant makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
action.text: The treant magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as an awakened tree (see the Monster Manual), except they can't speak. An animated tree acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies, until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree, or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 36

monster.name: Tree Blight
monster.languages: understands Common and Druidic but doesn't speak

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: If the blight is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the blight move or act, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the blight is animate.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The blight deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The blight makes one Branch attack and one Grasping Root attack.

action.name: Branch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: (3d6+6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Grasping Root
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature not grappled by the blight. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 9 (1d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The root has AC 15 and can be severed by dealing 6 or more slashing damage to it on one attack. Cutting the root doesn't hurt the blight but ends the grapple.

action.name: Bite (Bonus Action)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Curse of Strahd p. 230, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 84

monster.name: Warduke

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Warduke wears a dread helm (see appendix A) and wields a flame tongue longsword.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Warduke makes three Flame Tongue or Dagger attacks.

action.name: Flame Tongue
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage when used with two hands, plus 7 (2d6) fire damage if the weapon is aflame.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Flaming Blade (Bonus Action)
action.text: Warduke ignites or extinguishes his flame tongue longsword. While aflame, it sheds bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet.

action.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Warduke regains 13 hit points.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 221

monster.name: Will-o'-Wisp (Variant)
monster.languages: The languages it knew in life
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, necrotic, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.conditionImmune: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Consume Life
trait.text: As a bonus action, the will-o'-wisp can target one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that has 0 hit points and is still alive. The target must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw against this magic or die. If the target dies, the will-o'-wisp regains 10 (3d6) hit points.

trait.name: Ephemeral
trait.text: The will-o'-wisp can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The will-o'-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
trait.text: The will-o'-wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The will-o'-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

action.name: Shock
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Invisibility
action.text: The will-o'-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Consume Life, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

action.name: Magic Boon (Recharges after a Long Rest)
action.text: The will-o'-wisp grants a boon to one creature it can see within 5 feet of it that isn't an Undead. The boon's recipient gains a d4 and can, at any time within the next 24 hours, roll this die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw made by it. No creature can have more than one of these magic boons at a time.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 61

monster.name: Witchlight Hand (Small)

trait.name: Secret Expertise
trait.text: The hand has one of these additional skills: Acrobatics +6, Animal Handling +5, Arcana +5, Athletics +4, Medicine +5, or Performance +5.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Pixie Dust (1/Day)
action.text: The hand sprinkles a pinch of pixie dust on itself or another creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The recipient gains a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 minute. If the creature is airborne when this effect ends, it falls safely to the ground, taking no damage and landing on its feet.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The hand casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: dancing lights, message, prestidigitation

monster.spells: dancing lights, message, prestidigitation
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 27

monster.name: Witchlight Hand

trait.name: Secret Expertise
trait.text: The hand has one of these additional skills: Acrobatics +6, Animal Handling +5, Arcana +5, Athletics +4, Medicine +5, or Performance +5.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Pixie Dust (1/Day)
action.text: The hand sprinkles a pinch of pixie dust on itself or another creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The recipient gains a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 minute. If the creature is airborne when this effect ends, it falls safely to the ground, taking no damage and landing on its feet.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
The hand casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:
• At will: dancing lights, message, prestidigitation

monster.spells: dancing lights, message, prestidigitation
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 27

monster.name: Zarak

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Zarak carries a potion of invisibility.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Zarak makes two Dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, plus an extra 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the target is a creature and Zarak has at least 18 hit points.

action.name: Garrote
action.text:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Humanoid. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 11).
Until this grapple ends, the target takes 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage at the start of each of its turns, and Zarak can't grapple another creature or use Assassin's Whim.

action.name: Assassin's Whim (Bonus Action)
action.text: Zarak takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
reaction.text: Zarak halves the damage he takes from an attack made against him, provided he can see the attacker.

monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 222

monster.name: Zargash

trait.name: Cling to Life (Recharges after a Long Rest)
trait.text: The first time Zargash would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, he instead drops to 1 hit point.

trait.name: Special Equipment
trait.text: Zargash wears a bat-shaped amulet that has the properties of a ring of feather falling.

action.name: Warhammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage when used with two hands.

action.name: Deathly Ray
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spellcasting
action.text:
Zargash casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):
• At will: light, thaumaturgy • 1/Day each: command, gaseous form, hold person, silence, speak with dead

action.name: Animate Corpse (1/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: Zargash targets the lifeless corpse of one Humanoid he can see within 30 feet of him and commands it to rise, transforming it into a zombie under his control. The zombie takes its turn immediately after Zargash. Animating the zombie requires Zargash's concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). The zombie reverts to an inanimate corpse after 10 minutes, when it drops to 0 hit points, or when Zargash's concentration ends.

monster.spells: light, thaumaturgy, command, gaseous form, hold person, silence, speak with dead
monster.description: Source: The Wild Beyond the Witchlight p. 223
